creator: umagesh@apache.org
text:
I am no English expert or anything, but 0 seconds (with the s) is better than 
0 second.  But the *correct* fix would be to have 'No seconds' (with the s) 
printed instead of either 0 second or 0 seconds.

Follow this link and search for zero, to find the reason:
http://www.csse.monash.edu.au/~damian/papers/HTML/Plurals.html

creator: sbailliez@apache.org
text:
I have NEVER seen. time elapsed: 12 minutes no seconds

I won't epilogate on this as I'm not an native english speaker and epilogating 
about a published paper about algorithmic approach to pluralization won't bring 
us closer to the solution.

If no one can say what is correct or not change it to abbreviations and use 
MessageFormat with time formatting.

Even if you haven't seen it so far, saying either saying 12 minutes, no seconds 
(note the comma) or saying 12 minutes and no seconds, is the correct way, 
IMHO.  For example, I would say "I have three oranges, no apples and five 
bananas." in English - not zero apple. substitute oranges with hours, apples 
with minutes, bananas with seconds... ;-)
